pipeline.common¶

Common Pipelines for easy reuse.

class pipeline.common.AbortIfTrue(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Aborts the entire pipeline if the supplied argument is True.

class pipeline.common.All(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns True if all of the values are True.

Returns False if there are no values present.

class pipeline.common.Any(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns True if any of the values are True.

class pipeline.common.Append(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Combine together values into a list.

Args:
*args: One or more values.
Returns:
A single list of all values appended to the same list. Length of the output list matches the length of the input list.
class pipeline.common.Complement(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns the boolean complement of the values.

class pipeline.common.Concat(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Concatenates strings together using a join character.

Args:
*args: One or more strings. separator: Keyword argument only; the string to use to join the args.
Returns:
The joined string.
class pipeline.common.Delay(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Waits N seconds before completion.

Args:
seconds: Keyword argument only. The number of seconds to wait. Will be
rounded to the nearest whole second.
Returns:
How long this delay waited.
class pipeline.common.Dict(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a dictionary with the supplied keyword arguments.

class pipeline.common.EmailToContinue(**kwargs)[source]¶

Emails someone asking if the pipeline should continue.

When the user clicks “Approve”, the pipeline will return True. When the user clicks “Disapprove”, the pipeline will return False.

Supply normal mail.EmailMessage parameters, plus two additional parameters:

approve_html: HTML to show to the user after clicking approve. disapprove_html: HTML to show to the user after clicking disapprove.

Additionally, the ‘body’ and ‘html’ keyword arguments are treated as Python dictionary templates with the keywords ‘approval_url’ and ‘disapprove_url’, which let you place those links in your email however you want (as long as clicking the links results in a GET request). The approve/disapprove URLs are relative paths (e.g., ‘/relative/foo/bar’), so you must connect them to whatever hostname you actually want users to access the callback on with an absolute URL.

A random token is used to secure the asynchronous action.

class pipeline.common.Extend(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Combine together lists and tuples into a single list.

Args:
*args: One or more lists or tuples.
Returns:
A single list of all supplied lists merged together in order. Length of the output list is the sum of the lengths of all input lists.
class pipeline.common.Format(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Formats a string with formatting arguments.

classmethod dict(message, **format_dict)[source]¶

Formats a dictionary.

Args:

message: The format string. **format_dict: Keyword arguments of format parameters to use for

formatting the string.
Returns:
The formatted string.
classmethod tuple(message, *params)[source]¶

Formats a tuple.

Args:
message: The format string. *params: The formatting positional parameters.
Returns:
The formatted string.
class pipeline.common.Ignore(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Mark the supplied parameters as unused outputs of sibling pipelines.

class pipeline.common.Intersection(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns only those items belonging to all of the supplied lists.

Each argument must be a list. No individual items are permitted.

class pipeline.common.List(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a list with the supplied positional arguments.

class pipeline.common.Log(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Logs a message, just like the Python logging module.

class pipeline.common.Max(*args)[source]¶

Returns the max value.

class pipeline.common.Min(*args)[source]¶

Returns the min value.

class pipeline.common.Multiply(*args)[source]¶

Returns all values multiplied together.

class pipeline.common.Negate(*args)[source]¶

Returns each value supplied multiplied by -1.

class pipeline.common.Return(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Causes calling generator to have the supplied default output value.

Only works when yielded last!

class pipeline.common.Sum(*args)[source]¶

Returns the sum of all values.

class pipeline.common.Union(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Like Extend, but the resulting list has all unique elements.

class pipeline.common.Uniquify(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Returns a list of unique items from the list of items supplied.
